required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Pulse Fibre Supplementation on Obesity and the Metabolic Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Pulse Fibre Supplementation in Obesity and the Metabolic Syndrome: Generating Evidence in Support of Health Claims

brief_summary.textblock: The recent dramatic increase in obesity has been linked to a reduction of dietary fibre intake. We hypothesized that supplementing the diet of overweight and obesity adults with pulse fibre will improve their metabolic status, chiefly defined as greater weight loss. Other metabolic health improvements may include improved glucose control and reduced inflammatory markers.

detailed_description.textblock:
The main objective of our study is to assess the effects of pulse fibre supplementation on weight loss in an overweight and obese adult population.
Primary objective - To determine the effects of a 12 week intake of 15g/day of pea hull fibre on weight loss supported by body composition measures.
Secondary objective - To measure glucose control and appetite regulation in overweight and obese adults consuming 15g/day of pea hull fibre compared to a placebo control with the use of plasma HbA1c and an oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT).
Tertiary objective - To examine mechanisms of action of pulse fibre supplementation by determining the impact of pulse fibre supplementation on gut microbiota, serum metabolomics and fecal short-chain fatty acid and bile acid concentrations.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Fat Mass at 12 Weeks
primary_outcome.time_frame: Value at 12 weeks minus value at baseline
primary_outcome.description: Value at 12 weeks minus value at baseline assessed with dual energy x-ray absorptiometry.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Objective Appetite at 12 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Value at 12 weeks minus baseline energy intake during weighed lunch buffet.

other_outcome.description: Serum cytokine IL-6 measured at 12 weeks

other_outcome.measure: Alpha Diversity of Gut Microbiota at 12 Weeks
other_outcome.description: Gut microbiota alpha diversity measured at 12 weeks as Chao index. Chao index is an abundance-based estimator of species richness within a sample. There are no preset minimum and maximum values but scores typically range from 0 to 4000. A higher score is generally regarded as better.

Serum metabolomics measured at 12 weeks using 1H-NMR analysis. Principal component analysis is used to see if two or more groups of samples separate into distinct clusters. The principal components generated in this analysis range from 0-100%. A higher value means that more variability among the samples is explained by this principal component.
Fecal acetate concentration measured at 12 weeks
Fecal cholic acid concentration measured at 12 weeks

arm_group.description: The intervention group will receive a biscuit containing 5g/serving of yellow pea fibre to be eaten 3 times per day approximately 30 minutes prior to their 3 largest meals.

The placebo group will receive a biscuit an isocaloric control biscuit that is similar in taste and texture and without pulse fibre to be eaten 3 times per day approximately 30 minutes prior to their 3 largest meals.

intervention.description: Yellow pea hull fibre incorporated into a biscuit at 5 g/serving.
Control biscuit with no yellow pea hull fibre.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and females
- Age 18 - 70 years
- BMI 25 - 38 kg/m-2
- Stable body weight for at least 3 months prior to the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Concomitant use of any weight loss medication, diet or exercise regime
- Use of corticosteroids, anti-depressants, anti-epileptic medications, lipid lowering medication, diabetes medications
- Previous bariatric or other intestinal surgeries
- Pregnancy or lactation
- Weight loss > 3 kg within preceding 3 months to enrollment
- Use of bulk laxatives or probiotics/prebiotics supplements
- Antibiotic use in the past month
- Clinically significant cardiovascular or respiratory or liver disease

reference.citation: Lambert JE, Parnell JA, Han J, Sturzenegger T, Paul HA, Vogel HJ, Reimer RA. Evaluation of yellow pea fibre supplementation on weight loss and the gut microbiota: a randomized controlled trial. BMC Gastroenterol. 2014 Apr 8;14:69. doi: 10.1186/1471-230X-14-69.

results_reference.citation: Lambert JE, Parnell JA, Tunnicliffe JM, Han J, Sturzenegger T, Reimer RA. Consuming yellow pea fiber reduces voluntary energy intake and body fat in overweight/obese adults in a 12-week randomized controlled trial. Clin Nutr. 2017 Feb;36(1):126-133. doi: 10.1016/j.clnu.2015.12.016. Epub 2016 Jan 11.

Mayengbam S, Lambert JE, Parnell JA, Tunnicliffe JM, Nicolucci AC, Han J, Sturzenegger T, Shearer J, Mickiewicz B, Vogel HJ, Madsen KL, Reimer RA. Impact of dietary fiber supplementation on modulating microbiota-host-metabolic axes in obesity. J Nutr Biochem. 2019 Feb;64:228-236. doi: 10.1016/j.jnutbio.2018.11.003. Epub 2018 Nov 26.

group.title: Pulse Fibre
group.description: The intervention group will receive a biscuit containing 5g/serving of yellow pea fibre to be eaten 3 times per day approximately 30 minutes prior to their 3 largest meals. Pulse fibre: Yellow pea hull fibre incorporated into a biscuit at 5 g/serving.

group.title: Control
group.description: The placebo group will receive a biscuit an isocaloric control biscuit that is similar in taste and texture and without pulse fibre to be eaten 3 times per day approximately 30 minutes prior to their 3 largest meals. Control: Control biscuit with no yellow pea hull fibre.

outcome.title: Alpha Diversity of Gut Microbiota at 12 Weeks
outcome.description: Gut microbiota alpha diversity measured at 12 weeks as Chao index. Chao index is an abundance-based estimator of species richness within a sample. There are no preset minimum and maximum values but scores typically range from 0 to 4000. A higher score is generally regarded as better.

measure.title: Alpha Diversity of Gut Microbiota at 12 Weeks
measure.description: Gut microbiota alpha diversity measured at 12 weeks as Chao index. Chao index is an abundance-based estimator of species richness within a sample. There are no preset minimum and maximum values but scores typically range from 0 to 4000. A higher score is generally regarded as better.

outcome.title: Serum Metabolomics at 12 Weeks
outcome.description: Serum metabolomics measured at 12 weeks using 1H-NMR analysis. Principal component analysis is used to see if two or more groups of samples separate into distinct clusters. The principal components generated in this analysis range from 0-100%. A higher value means that more variability among the samples is explained by this principal component.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
